result.execSummary:
All charges against Rashad J Hampton in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rashad J Hampton is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rashad J Hampton

records.addlTxt:
9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rashad J Hampton in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Rashad J Hampton. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State is moving for dismissal.
BTC: Motion to dismiss granted. Case dismissed without prejudice.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rashad J Hampton in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Rashad J Hampton. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State asks the court to take Judicial Notice that the deft was on Felony bond in MKE County at the time of the Alleged offense.
Court takes Judicial Notice of Felony Bond conditions held in a MKE Case at the time of the alleged offense. 
State Calls Officer S. Plew, DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defense on cross.
Witness is released.
Defense Calls Witness Debbie Davis. 
Witness does not have counsel, nor spoken with representation.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant about proceeding without counsel.
BTC:
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rashad J Hampton appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Rashad J Hampton. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Defense moves to dismiss the Firearm enhancer on counts 1 and 2, with argument.
State objects with argument.
BTC: Motion to dismiss denied
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
